posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I've just been rereading "Toll the Hounds": one of Steven Erikson's Malazan books, and therein is the character of Fisher. Now, Fisher is a legendary bard, with many epic poems and ballads, composed over many years, to his name. In this particular tale, he is triggered into action - despite ordinarily being merely an observer and recorder of great events throughout history - and he proves exceptionally effective with his sword (my guess would be a rapier).

Tie this in with my turgid plodding through an attempt to play a full-blown caster (hating it, btw), and I wondered, is there a way to build a sort of Exalted Sorceress, but with maybe Bard and CoT instead of Sorcerer and Pally?

I don't see that there's any point going into a Build Request before canvassing opinion here first.

Cheers

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
Nothing says you must go DEX based.
Bard is an excellent spellsword just as it goes, and there are plenty to work with.

If no Alignment changes there's also Barb for UD.

I assume Lasting Inspiration and non dispellable.

Bard 24 or 26.
CoT 10/Cleric4(or even less) for Divine Shield/Might.

BGuard4/RDD10 for some serious smackdown, probably done to death and possibly wrong RP wise. For Dex based, I would go Rogue, and then I wonder, do you NEED CoT? Bard26/SD1/Rogue13 is solid.

Shall we mention it? Featstarved maybe, but interesting with rapier:

Bard20/Fighter4/WM16.

Bard25/CoT8/WM7.

I see nothing wrong with strength bard at all. I get the feeling you want DEX tho, if so let the silly weapon master be.

I have done a Bardbarian with terrifying rage once, and it's cool. Curse song - Bardsong - Rage.

posts.author: The Searing Wind
posts.content:
How about elven/human/halfling Bard X / WM 7 or 10?

If you take WM levels pre-epic it gives you enough BAB for 4 APR even if you don't play human and some nice criticals in mid-epic to do good damage on everything that isn't undead or construct because your AB is high enough thanks to weapon finesse. And those can be taken out through spells, scrolls and UMD, I believe, which bard has in abundance.

Also, your effective UMD, provided you take 16 CHA, gives you opportunity to go for robes of Darkmoon very early. So one more attack, +4 AC, no problem with casting and pretty high AC thanks to high (should be about 20 if you take Tumble and don't forget about Expertise with its +5 to make it 25 for fights). Isn't that nice?

Though I'm torn about making a DEX build that doesn't have Uncanny Dodge. Maybe a halfling and 3 rogue levels or human and thus just 2 levels of barbarian for UD and rage would do the trick.

Good luck with your build!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Personally, I find the cost of WM too dear in a Bard-centric build - especially if I'm only going for minor levels. Mobility, Spring Attack, Whirlwind Attack (and possibly Dodge and Expertise) would all be tough to fit in with so many other more necessary demands on those feats: and you only need to lose 1 to negate eligibility for the class. Effectively, you need 6 of your 7 feats (8 if human) to get WM: leaving you to pick between Blind Fight, Knockdown, Imp Crit, Bard-specific feats (Curse Song, SkF: Perform, any spelly feats), and Weapon Finesse if Dexing.

Problematic, to say the least.

Cheers

The main weakness of this build is that it can't wear heavy armor while it doesn't get Uncanny Dodge (so its AC will suffer when flatfooted, especially when taunting). On the other hand, it will get AC from bard buffs (bard song, curse song, taunt) so as long as it can keep up important immunities (freedom, mind spell immunity, knockdown immunity) and stay aware, maybe it will be ok. That would be one reason to build it as an elf, actually, to lessen the threat of sneak attacks.

Anyway, this probably wasn't so helpful but there was some talk about making weaponmaster work for a bard so I tried to design something good and I ended up with something very similar to something already done before.
